text:
Before policies
(https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/edge/business/download?form=MA13FJ) are added
to C:\Windows\PolicyDefinitions: 
2024-02-06_22-03-22.jpg [cid:2e5db238-9f90-4f7a-a7a8-b449686bbe4e]
2024-02-06_22-05-53.jpg [cid:a734654f-66a9-489c-b31b-21a798876eb0] 
After: 
2024-02-06_22-06-54.jpg [cid:9cc80ca3-4ee8-4321-b2ce-3f39ffaa2adb] 
2024-02-06_22-06-17.jpg [cid:4a2802cb-9008-43b0-9efd-64734371343c] 
PowerShell:
(Save as HideFirstRunExperience.ps1) 
$RegistryPath = "HKLM:\ SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge"
$Name = "HideFirstRunExperience"
$Value = "1"
if (!(Test-Path $RegistryPath)) {
New-Item -Path $RegistryPath -Force | Out-Null
New-ItemProperty -Path $RegistryPath -Name $Name -Value $Value -PropertyType
DWORD -Force
}
else {
New-ItemProperty -Path $RegistryPath -Name $Name -Value $Value -PropertyType
DWORD -Force
}

metadata.topic: Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or just plain Edge?
metadata.subject: Re: [patchmanagement] Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or just plain Edge?

important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification]
